subtopic: Educational Institutions - Major Colleges and Universities

flashcards.back: Founder: Warren Hastings. Year: 1781. Details: First institution for the study of Muslim culture and traditions in India
Founder: Jonathan Duncan. Year: 1791. Details: Focused on Sanskrit studies and ancient Indian learning
Founder: David Hare. Year: 1817. Details: One of the first institutions to introduce Western education in India
Founder: Raja Ram Mohan Roy. Year: 1825. Details: Aimed at synthesising Western learning with Vedantic ideals
Founder: Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar (Established by J.E. Bethune). Year: 1849. Details: First school for girls in Calcutta, promoted by Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar
Founder: Lord Canning (Governor General). Year: 1857. Details: Established as part of the British policy to educate Indians

flashcards.front: Thomson College of Civil Engineering (IIT Roorkee) (1847)?
flashcards.back: Founder: James Thomson. Year: 1847. Details: Renowned institution for engineering education, now part of IIT Roorkee

Founder: Annie Besant (Established, converted to Banaras Hindu University by Madan Mohan Malviya). Year: Date not specified. Details: Initially set up as a school, later became part of Banaras Hindu University
Founder: Sayyid Ahmad Khan. Year: 1875. Details: Later became Aligarh Muslim University, pivotal in Muslim education
Founder: Sayyid Ahmed Barelvi (Later transferred to Delhi, became Jamia Millia Islamia). Year: Date not specified. Details: Initially founded in Aligarh, later moved to Delhi
Founder: Vishnushastri Chiplunkar, Bal Gangadhar Tilak, M.B. Namjoshi, G.G. Agarkar. Year: 1880s. Details: Later became Fergusson College, a major institution in Pune
Founder: Aurobindo Ghosh. Year: 1906. Details: Established to promote national education, under the leadership of Aurobindo Ghosh
Founder: Maharishi Karve. Year: 1916. Details: Focused on women's education, founded by Maharishi Karve

mcq.question: Calcutta Madrasah (1781) founded by?
mcq.explanation: Calcutta Madrasah (1781) founded by Warren Hastings, first institution for study of Muslim culture and traditions in India.

mcq.question: Sanskrit College (Varanasi) founded in?
mcq.explanation: Sanskrit College (Varanasi) founded in 1791 by Jonathan Duncan, focused on Sanskrit studies and ancient Indian learning.

mcq.question: Hindu College (Calcutta) (1817) significance?
options: One of the first institutions to introduce Western education in India
mcq.explanation: Hindu College (Calcutta, 1817) founded by David Hare was one of first institutions to introduce Western education in India.

mcq.question: Vedanta College (Calcutta) (1825) founded by?
mcq.explanation: Vedanta College (Calcutta, 1825) founded by Raja Ram Mohan Roy, aimed at synthesising Western learning with Vedantic ideals.

mcq.question: Bethune School (Calcutta) (1849) significance?
options: First school for girls in Calcutta
mcq.explanation: Bethune School (Calcutta, 1849) was first school for girls in Calcutta, promoted by Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar.

mcq.question: Three Universities (Calcutta, Madras, Bombay) established in?
mcq.explanation: Three Universities (Calcutta, Madras, Bombay) established in 1857 by Lord Canning as part of British policy to educate Indians.

mcq.question: Thomson College of Civil Engineering (1847) now part of?
mcq.explanation: Thomson College of Civil Engineering (1847) founded by James Thomson, now part of IIT Roorkee.

mcq.question: Muhammadan Anglo-Oriental College (MAO) (1875) founded by?
mcq.explanation: Muhammadan Anglo-Oriental College (MAO, 1875) founded by Sayyid Ahmad Khan, later became Aligarh Muslim University.

mcq.question: New English School (Bombay, 1880s) later became?
mcq.explanation: New English School (Bombay, 1880s) founded by Tilak, Chiplunkar, Namjoshi, Agarkar, later became Fergusson College, Pune.

mcq.question: National Council of Education (Calcutta) (1906) founded by?
mcq.explanation: National Council of Education (Calcutta, 1906) founded by Aurobindo Ghosh to promote national education.

mcq.question: SNDT Women's University (1916) founded by?
mcq.explanation: SNDT Women's University (1916) founded by Maharishi Karve, focused on women's education.

mcq.question: Which institution became Jamia Millia Islamia?
options: National Muslim University (initially Aligarh, moved to Delhi)
mcq.explanation: National Muslim University founded by Sayyid Ahmed Barelvi, initially in Aligarh, later moved to Delhi and became Jamia Millia Islamia.
